com.complexible.common.io
Interface SegmentedFile

All Superinterfaces:
Flushable
public interface SegmentedFile
extends Flushable

Utility class to help with memory mapping very large files in relatively small segments. File contents are memory-mapped incrementally in segments so creating smaller files is faster. This class only provides ByteBuffer instances for read and write operations. No read or write operation is allowed over the boundaries of two segments. This makes the class suitable for managing paged access to a file as long as the segment size is a multiple of page size used.

This class is thread-safe in a limited way. A new ByteBuffer is returned every time which is a view over the underlying file contents. Reading or writing different parts of the same segment concurrently is perfectly fine. Reading or writing overlapping parts of a segment concurrently will have undefined results.

Author:
Evren Sirin

Field Detail

DEFAULT_SEGMENT_SIZE

static final int DEFAULT_SEGMENT_SIZE
See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getBuffer

ByteBuffer getBuffer(long offset)
                     throws IOException
Returns a buffer that starts at the given offset and limited until the end of the segment this buffer is located in. The file length will be increased if the offset exceed the current file length.

Throws:
IOException

getBuffer

ByteBuffer getBuffer(long offset,
                     int length)
                     throws IOException
Returns a buffer that starts at the given offset and has at most length bytes in it. If the requested length starting from the given offset exceed the segment boundary the limit of the returned buffer will be adjusted accordingly. The file length will be increased if the offset exceed the current file length.

Throws:
IOException

getSegmentSize

int getSegmentSize()
The segment size used by this class internally.

The max segment number that has been used so far.

The length of the file in bytes.
